definitions.definition: Having two or more separate aspects.
examples: I get a very mixed feeling from this puzzling painting.
The various studies produced mixed results.

definitions.definition: Not completely pure , tainted or adulterated .
examples: My joy was somewhat mixed when my partner said she was pregnant: it's a lot of responsibility.
The tennis match was mixed , with a boy and a girl on each side.
My son attends a mixed school, my daughter an all-girl grammar school.

definitions.definition: Stemming from two or more races or breeds .
examples: The benefit dog show has both mixed and single-breed competitions.
Mixed blood can surprisingly produce inherited properties which neither parent showed

definitions.definition: Polarizing ; including both positive and negative feedback.
examples: The movie has received mixed reviews from movie critics.

main_definition: Having two or more separate aspects.
secondary_definitions: Not completely pure , tainted or adulterated .
Stemming from two or more races or breeds .
Polarizing ; including both positive and negative feedback.
